text: Clay Johnston (born August 8, 1996) is an American football linebacker for the Carolina Panthers of the National Football League (NFL). He played college football at Baylor. ==College career== Johnston missed several games in 2017. Johnston was a second-team all-Big 12 Conference selection in 2018 after recording a team-high 99 tackles. As a senior, he made 58 tackles, eight for loss, 2.5 sacks, one interception, and five pass breakups. Johnston only played six games due to a knee injury that ended his season early. He was again named to the second-team All-Big 12. ==Professional career== ===Los Angeles Rams=== Johnston was selected by the Los Angeles Rams in the seventh round (234th overall) of the 2020 NFL Draft. He was waived on September 5, 2020. ===Carolina Panthers=== On September 8, 2020, Johnston was signed to the Carolina Panthers practice squad. ==Personal life== His father, Kent Johnston, was a strength coach for over two decades in the NFL, and was also Brett Favre’s best man for his wedding. He has three brothers Kody, Kole, and Cade. ==References== ==External links== *Baylor Bears bio Category:1996 births Category:American football linebackers Category:Baylor Bears football players Category:Carolina Panthers players Category:Living people Category:Los Angeles Rams players Category:Players of American football from Texas Category:Players of American football from Wisconsin Category:Sportspeople from Abilene, Texas Category:Sportspeople from Green Bay, Wisconsin
title: Clay Johnston (American football)
